sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SANATRUCES, (Sinairuces, Pers. Sanatruk) , Parthian king. In the troublous times after the death of Mithradates II. (c. 88 B.c.) he was made king by the Sacaraucae, a Mongolian tribe who had invaded Iran in 76 B.c. He was eighty years old and reigned seven years; his successor was his son Phraates III. (Lucian, Macrob. 15; Phlegon, fr. 12 ap. Phot. cod. 97; Appian, Mithr, 104; Dio Cass. xxxvi. 45). Another Sanatruces (Sanatrucius) is mentioned as an ephemeral Parthian king in a.d. 115 (Malalas, Chron. p. 270, 273). (Ed. M.)
